Translations

Sometimes I make translations.

Nobody should ever expect to read a translated work of foreign literature without encountering the unfamiliar. My total preference is to confront the reader with the unfamiliar and the difficult. What’s the purpose of translation otherwise?
Roger Allen
Guillermo Cabrera Infante
